name: John Smith
desc: John Smith is a chef, presenter and best selling author who specialises in Middle Eastern and North African cuisine. He has written six cookbooks

cooking_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add the eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract, and whisk until smooth.
Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let cool before serving.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
In a skillet, cook the ground beef, onion, green pepper, and garlic over medium heat until browned.
Drain the excess fat, then add the diced tomatoes and tomato paste.
Simmer for 10 minutes, then season with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning to taste.
In a 9x13 inch baking dish, spread a layer of the meat sauce, then a layer of uncooked lasagna noodles.
Repeat layers, ending with a layer of meat sauce on top.
Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until the noodles are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Let cool before serving.

ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
cooking_instructions: In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the pan and sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add the curry powder and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the coconut milk, diced tomatoes, and tomato sauce.
Return the chicken to the pan and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve over rice.

name: Maria Hernandez
desc: Maria Hernandez, from America.Maria has always loved to Cook, and in some way or another, she has been doing it since she was 17, making this role a natural fit for him.

cooking_instructions: Cut the avocados in half and remove the pits.
Scoop the avocado flesh into a bowl and mash with a fork or potato masher.
Add the onion, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Stir to combine.
Serve with tortilla chips.
In a large skillet, cook the beef and onion over medium heat until the beef is browned and the onion is tender.
Add the green chilies, refried beans, chili powder, and cumin.
Cook for 5-10 minutes, or until heated through.
Spoon about 1/2 cup of the beef mixture onto each tortilla.
Sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Fold the sides of the tortilla in and then roll it up tightly.
Heat the oil in a deep fryer or heavy skillet to 375°F.
Fry the chimichangas, a few at a time, for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with salsa, sour cream, and guacamole, if desired.

ingredients: 1 can (15 oz.) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (10 oz.) diced tomatoes and green chilies, undrained
cooking_instructions: In a large skillet, cook the beef and onion over medium heat until the beef is browned and the onion is tender.
Drain the excess grease.
Add the kidney beans, corn, tomatoes and green chilies, salad dressing, and taco sauce.
Cook for 5-10 minutes, or until heated through.
Arrange the lettuce on a large serving platter.
Spoon the beef mixture over the lettuce.
Sprinkle with crushed tortilla chips and shredded cheese.
Serve immediately.

name: Maria Rodriguez
desc: Rodriguez ultimately decided to enroll in the food engineering program and went on to earn a master’s degree in food engineering from Valencia Polytechnic University in Spain. Today, she serves as the chief food innovation and quality officer at Yum! Brands/Pizza Hut International.

ingredients: 1 can (2.25 oz.) sliced black olives, drained
cooking_instructions: In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned and no longer pink.
Drain any excess grease.
Add the taco seasoning mix and stir to coat the meat.
In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, onion, green bell pepper, tomato, Cheddar cheese, and black olives.
Add the cooked ground beef and toss to combine.
Add the corn chips and salad dressing.
Toss again to coat everything in the dressing.
Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 can (15 oz.) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 oz.) pinto beans, drained and rinsed
cooking_instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the ground beef, onion, and green bell pepper over medium-high heat until the beef is browned and the vegetables are tender.
Drain any excess grease.
Add the diced tomatoes, kidney beans, pinto beans, tomato sauce, water, and chili seasoning mix.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with your favorite chili toppings, such as shredded cheese, sour cream, or chopped onions.
In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the pan and sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add the curry powder and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the coconut milk, diced tomatoes, and tomato sauce.
Return the chicken to the pan and bring the mixture to a simmer.
